scenarios.label: Baseline / Recommended
scenarios.description: Single small Linux VM for an internal tool, minimal but production-safe with basic security, backup, and monitoring defaults.

resources.notes: Single VNet for the internal VM workload; no direct cost but required for networking.
General-purpose Linux VM hosting the internal tool. Assumes 64 GB Premium SSD OS disk, moderate network egress for internal users via VPN or private access. No scale set or autoscaling.
Premium SSD v2 or Premium SSD P6 OS disk (64 GB) attached to the VM. IOPS/throughput are approximate for pricing.

sku_candidates.product_name: Azure Data Lake Storage Gen2 Hierarchical Namespace

resources.notes: Single Log Analytics workspace for VM metrics and logs. Assumes ~10 GB/month ingestion for a small workload.
Azure Backup vault protecting the single VM with daily backups and 30-day retention. 200 GB backup storage assumed including growth and retention.
resources.meter_name: ADLS Gen2 Vaulted LRS Write Operations

sku_candidates.meter_name: ADLS Gen2 Vaulted LRS Write Operations
ADLS Gen2 Vaulted ZRS Write Operations
ADLS Gen2 Vaulted RA-GRS Write Operations
ADLS Gen2 Vaulted GRS Write Operations

resources.notes: Standard Key Vault for secrets/certs used by the VM. Operation count is a conservative estimate for pricing.
NAT Gateway for outbound internet access from the VM with a static public IP. Assumes ~50 GB/month egress for updates and light usage.
resources.meter_name: Standard Inter-Availability Zone Data Transfer Out

sku_candidates.meter_name: Standard Inter-Availability Zone Data Transfer Out

resources.notes: Standard public IP used by the NAT Gateway for outbound connectivity. No direct inbound exposure to the VM assumed.
Azure Bastion Basic for secure browser-based RDP/SSH to the VM without exposing a public IP on the VM. Assumes it is used only during working hours (~160 hours/month).

scenarios.label: Cost Optimized
scenarios.description: Cheaper single VM setup for an internal tool with reduced size and hours, still using basic backup and monitoring.

resources.notes: Same logical VNet as baseline; no direct cost.
Burstable B2s Linux VM, assumed to be shut down outside business hours (~400 hours/month). Smaller 32 GB OS disk and lower egress for a light internal tool.
Smaller Premium SSD P4 OS disk (32 GB) to reduce storage cost.

resources.notes: Log Analytics with reduced ingestion (~5 GB/month) by limiting collected logs to essentials.
Azure Backup with shorter retention (e.g., 14 days) and smaller protected data footprint (~100 GB).

resources.notes: Standard Key Vault with fewer operations due to smaller workload.
NAT Gateway used mainly during VM uptime (~400 hours/month). Lower egress assumed.
resources.meter_name: Standard Inter-Availability Zone Data Transfer Out

sku_candidates.meter_name: Standard Inter-Availability Zone Data Transfer Out

resources.notes: Standard public IP for NAT Gateway, billed only for assumed active hours.
Bastion used only occasionally for admin access (~80 hours/month) to reduce cost.

scenarios.label: High Performance
scenarios.description: More powerful single VM for heavier internal workloads, with higher compute and storage performance and full-time availability.

resources.notes: Same logical VNet; no direct cost.
Larger D4s_v3 Linux VM (4 vCPUs, 16 GB RAM) for heavier internal workloads. Assumes 128 GB OS disk and higher network throughput and egress.
Premium SSD P10 OS disk (128 GB) with higher IOPS and throughput for more demanding workloads.

resources.notes: Standard Key Vault with higher operation volume due to more intensive workload and possible certificate/secret rotations.
NAT Gateway for full-time outbound connectivity with higher egress (~100 GB/month) for heavier usage and updates.

resources.notes: Standard public IP for NAT Gateway, available 24x7.
Bastion Basic with more frequent admin access (~200 hours/month) for managing the higher-load VM.
